title: NIST J.A.R.V.I.S. db entry `atoms` key schema. Based on https://figshare.com/articles/dataset/Monolayer_data_for_heterostructure/22344571

lattice_mat.description: Crystal lattice vectors as a 3x3 matrix, in Angstroms

coords.description: Atomic coordinates for each atom in the unit cell

elements.description: Atomic elements for each atom in the unit cell in the same order as `coords`

cartesian.description: True if the coordinates are in Cartesian space, false if in fractional space

props.description: Additional properties for each of the atoms

title: NIST J.A.R.V.I.S. db entry schema. Based on https://figshare.com/articles/dataset/Monolayer_data_for_heterostructure/22344571

atoms.title: NIST J.A.R.V.I.S. db entry `atoms` key schema. Based on https://figshare.com/articles/dataset/Monolayer_data_for_heterostructure/22344571

lattice_mat.description: Crystal lattice vectors as a 3x3 matrix, in Angstroms

coords.description: Atomic coordinates for each atom in the unit cell

elements.description: Atomic elements for each atom in the unit cell in the same order as `coords`

cartesian.description: True if the coordinates are in Cartesian space, false if in fractional space

props.description: Additional properties for each of the atoms

jid.description: The id of the entry in the database, e.g. JVASP-677

title: atomic positions schema
description: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1493

X.description: label of the atom as specified in ATOMIC_SPECIES

label of the atom. Acceptable syntax: chemical symbol X (1 or 2 characters, case-insensitive) or chemical symbol plus a number or a letter, as in "Xn" (e.g. Fe1) or "X_*" or "X-*" (e.g. C1, C_h; max total length cannot exceed 3 characters)

Mass_X.description: mass of the atomic species [amu: mass of C = 12]. Used only when performing Molecular Dynamics run or structural optimization runs using Damped MD. Not actually used in all other cases (but stored in data files, so phonon calculations will use these values unless other values are provided)

press.description: Target pressure [KBar] in a variable-cell md or relaxation run.

wmass.description: Fictitious cell mass [amu] for variable-cell simulations (both 'vc-md' and 'vc-relax'). Default: 0.75*Tot_Mass/pi**2 for Parrinello-Rahman MD; 0.75*Tot_Mass/pi**2/Omega**(2/3) for Wentzcovitch MD

cell_factor.description: Used in the construction of the pseudopotential tables. It should exceed the maximum linear contraction of the cell during a simulation. Default: 2.0 for variable-cell calculations, 1.0 otherwise

press_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold on the pressure for variable cell relaxation ('vc-relax' : note that the other convergence thresholds for ionic relaxation apply as well).

cell_dofree.description: Select which of the cell parameters should be moved

card_option.description: label of the atom. Acceptable syntax: chemical symbol X (1 or 2 characters, case-insensitive) or chemical symbol plus a number or a letter, as in "Xn" (e.g. Fe1) or "X_*" or "X-*" (e.g. C1, C_h; max total length cannot exceed 3 characters)

calculation.description: A string describing the task to be performed

verbosity.description: Currently two verbosity levels are implemented: high, low. 'debug' and 'medium' have the same effect as 'high'; 'default' and 'minimal' as 'low'

nstep.description: Default: 1 if calculation == 'scf', 'nscf', 'bands'; 50 for the other cases; Number of molecular-dynamics or structural optimization steps performed in this run. If set to 0, the code performs a quick "dry run", stopping just after initialization. This is useful to check for input correctness and to have the summary printed. NOTE: in MD calculations, the code will perform "nstep" steps even if restarting from a previously interrupted calculation.

iprint.description: band energies are written every iprint iterations

tstress.description: calculate stress. It is set to .TRUE. automatically if calculation == 'vc-md' or 'vc-relax'

tprnfor.description: calculate forces. It is set to .TRUE. automatically if calculation == 'relax','md','vc-md'

dt.description: time step for molecular dynamics, in Rydberg atomic units (1 a.u.=4.8378 * 10^-17 s : beware, the CP code uses Hartree atomic units, half that much!!!)

outdir.description: input, temporary, output files are found in this directory, see also wfcdir

wfcdir.description: This directory specifies where to store files generated by each processor (*.wfc{N}, *.igk{N}, etc.). Useful for machines without a parallel file system: set wfcdir to a local file system, while outdir should be a parallel or network file system, visible to all processors. Beware: in order to restart from interrupted runs, or to perform further calculations using the produced data files, you may need to copy files to outdir. Works only for pw.x.

prefix.description: prepended to input/output filenames: prefix.wfc, prefix.rho, etc.

max_seconds.description: Jobs stops after max_seconds CPU time. Use this option in conjunction with option restart_mode if you need to split a job too long to complete into shorter jobs that fit into your batch queues.

etot_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold on total energy (a.u) for ionic minimization: the convergence criterion is satisfied when the total energy changes less than etot_conv_thr between two consecutive scf steps. Note that etot_conv_thr is extensive, like the total energy. See also forc_conv_thr - both criteria must be satisfied

forc_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold on forces (a.u) for ionic minimization: the convergence criterion is satisfied when all components of all forces are smaller than forc_conv_thr. See also etot_conv_thr - both criteria must be satisfied

disk_io.description: Specifies the amount of disk I/O activity: (only for binary files and xml data file in data directory; other files printed at each molecular dynamics / structural optimization step are not controlled by this option )

pseudo_dir.description: directory containing pseudopotential files. Default: value of the $ESPRESSO_PSEUDO environment variable if set; '$HOME/espresso/pseudo/' otherwise

tefield.description: If .TRUE. a saw-like potential simulating an electric field is added to the bare ionic potential. See variables edir, eamp, emaxpos, eopreg for the form and size of the added potential.

dipfield.description: If .TRUE. and tefield==.TRUE. a dipole correction is also added to the bare ionic potential - implements the recipe of L. Bengtsson, PRB 59, 12301 (1999). See variables edir, emaxpos, eopreg for the form of the correction. Must be used ONLY in a slab geometry, for surface calculations, with the discontinuity FALLING IN THE EMPTY SPACE.

lelfield.description: If .TRUE. a homogeneous finite electric field described through the modern theory of the polarization is applied. This is different from tefield == .true. !

nberrycyc.description: In the case of a finite electric field  ( lelfield == .TRUE. ) it defines the number of iterations for converging the wavefunctions in the electric field Hamiltonian, for each external iteration on the charge density

lberry.description: If .TRUE. perform a Berry phase calculation. See the header of PW/src/bp_c_phase.f90 for documentation

gdir.description: For Berry phase calculation: direction of the k-point strings in reciprocal space. Allowed values: 1, 2, 3 1=first, 2=second, 3=third reciprocal lattice vector For calculations with finite electric fields (lelfield==.true.) "gdir" is the direction of the field.

nppstr.description: For Berry phase calculation: number of k-points to be calculated along each symmetry-reduced string. The same for calculation with finite electric fields (lelfield==.true.).

gate.description: In the case of charged cells (tot_charge .ne. 0) setting gate = .TRUE. represents the counter charge (i.e. -tot_charge) not by a homogeneous background charge but with a charged plate, which is placed at zgate (see below). Details of the gate potential can be found in T. Brumme, M. Calandra, F. Mauri; PRB 89, 245406 (2014). Note, that in systems which are not symmetric with respect to the plate, one needs to enable the dipole correction! (dipfield=.true.). Currently, symmetry can be used with gate=.true. but carefully check that no symmetry is included which maps z to -z even if in principle one could still use them for symmetric systems (i.e. no dipole correction). For nosym=.false. verbosity is set to 'high'. Note: this option was called "monopole" in v6.0 and 6.1 of pw.x

twochem.description: IF .TRUE. , a two chemical potential calculation for the simulation of photoexcited systems is performed, constraining a fraction of the electrons in the conduction manifold.

lfcp.description: If .TRUE. perform a constant bias potential (constant-mu) calculation for a system with ESM method. See the header of PW/src/fcp_module.f90 for documentation. To perform the calculation, you must set a namelist FCP.

trism.description: If .TRUE. perform a 3D-RISM-SCF calculation [for details see H.Sato et al., JCP 112, 9463 (2000), doi:10.1063/1.481564]. The solvent's distributions are calculated by 3D-RISM, though solute is treated as SCF. The charge density and the atomic positions are optimized, simultaneously with the solvents. To perform the calculation, you must set a namelist RISM and a card SOLVENTS. If assume_isolated = 'esm' and esm_bc = 'bc1', Laue-RISM is calculated instead of 3D-RISM and coupled with ESM method (i.e. ESM-RISM). [for details see S.Nishihara and M.Otani, PRB 96, 115429 (2017)]. The default of mixing_beta is 0.2 for both 3D-RISM and Laue-RISM. For structural relaxation with BFGS, ignore_wolfe is always .TRUE. .

electron_maxstep.description: maximum number of iterations in a scf step. If exact exchange is active, this will affect the inner loops.

exx_maxstep.description: maximum number of outer iterations in a scf calculation with exact exchange.

scf_must_converge.description: If .false. do not stop molecular dynamics or ionic relaxation when electron_maxstep is reached. Use with care.

adaptive_thr.description: If .TRUE. this turns on the use of an adaptive conv_thr for the inner scf loops when using EXX.

conv_thr_init.description: When adaptive_thr = .TRUE. this is the convergence threshold used for the first scf cycle.

conv_thr_multi.description: When adaptive_thr = .TRUE. the convergence threshold for each scf cycle is given by: max( conv_thr, conv_thr_multi * dexx )

mixing_ndim.description: number of iterations used in mixing scheme

mixing_fixed_ns.description: For DFT+U : number of iterations with fixed ns ( ns is the atomic density appearing in the Hubbard term ).

diago_thr_init.description: Convergence threshold (ethr) for iterative diagonalization (the check is on eigenvalue convergence).

diago_cg_maxiter.description: For conjugate gradient diagonalization:  max number of iterations

diago_ppcg_maxiter.description: For ppcg diagonalization:  max number of iterations

diago_david_ndim.description: For Davidson diagonalization: dimension of workspace (number of wavefunction packets, at least 2 needed).

diago_rmm_ndim.description: For RMM-DIIS diagonalization: dimension of workspace (number of wavefunction packets, at least 2 needed).

diago_rmm_conv.description: If .TRUE., RMM-DIIS is performed up to converge. If .FALSE., RMM-DIIS is performed only once.

diago_gs_nblock.description: For RMM-DIIS diagonalization: blocking size of Gram-Schmidt orthogonalization

diago_full_acc.description: If .TRUE. all the empty states are diagonalized at the same level of accuracy of the occupied ones. Otherwise the empty states are diagonalized using a larger threshold (this should not affect total energy, forces, and other ground-state properties).

efield.description: Amplitude of the finite electric field (in Ry a.u.; 1 a.u. = 36.3609*10^10 V/m). Used only if lelfield==.TRUE. and if k-points (K_POINTS card) are not automatic.

tqr.description: If .true., use a real-space algorithm for augmentation charges of ultrasoft pseudopotentials and PAWsets. Faster but numerically less accurate than the default G-space algorithm. Use with care and after testing!

real_space.description: If .true., exploit real-space localization to compute matrix elements for nonlocal projectors. Faster and in principle better scaling than the default G-space algorithm, but numerically less accurate, may lead to some loss of translational invariance. Use with care and after testing!

oneOf.description: IF DFT+U
https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1764

U.description: string constant "U"; indicates the specs for the U parameter will be given

label.description: label of the atom (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

u_val.description: value of the U parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1784

J0.description: string constant "J0"; indicates the specs for the J0 parameter will be given

label.description: label of the atom (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

j0_val.description: value of the J0 parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: IF DFT+U+J

items.description: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1817

paramType.description: character describing the type of Hubbard parameter allowed values: U, J and either B (for d-orbitals) or E2 and E3 (for f-orbitals)

label.description: label of the atom (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

paramValue.description: value of the J0 parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: IF DFT+U+V
https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1847

U.description: string constant "U"; indicates the specs for the U parameter will be given

label.description: label of the atom (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

u_val.description: value of the U parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1865

J0.description: string constant "J0"; indicates the specs for the J0 parameter will be given

label.description: label of the atom (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

j0_val.description: value of the J0 parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1884

V.description: string constant "V"; indicates the specs for the V parameter will be given

label(I).description: label of the atom I (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

manifold(I).description: specs of the manifold for atom I (e.g., 3d, 2p...)

label(J).description: label of the atom J (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

manifold(J).description: specs of the manifold for atom J (e.g., 3d, 2p...)

v_val(I,J).description: value of the V parameter for the atom pair I,J (in eV)

pot_extrapolation.description: Used to extrapolate the potential from preceding ionic steps.

wfc_extrapolation.description: Used to extrapolate the wavefunctions from preceding ionic steps.

remove_rigid_rot.description: This keyword is useful when simulating the dynamics and/or the thermodynamics of an isolated system. If set to true the total torque of the internal forces is set to zero by adding new forces that compensate the spurious interaction with the periodic images. This allows for the use of smaller supercells.

tempw.description: Starting temperature (Kelvin) in MD runs target temperature for most thermostats.

tolp.description: Tolerance for velocity rescaling. Velocities are rescaled if the run-averaged and target temperature differ more than tolp.

refold_pos.description: This keyword applies only in the case of molecular dynamics or damped dynamics. If true the ions are refolded at each step into the supercell.

upscale.description: Max reduction factor for conv_thr during structural optimization conv_thr is automatically reduced when the relaxation approaches convergence so that forces are still accurate, but conv_thr will not be reduced to less that conv_thr / upscale.

bfgs_ndim.description: Number of old forces and displacements vectors used in the PULAY mixing of the residual vectors obtained on the basis of the inverse hessian matrix given by the BFGS algorithm.

trust_radius_max.description: Maximum ionic displacement in the structural relaxation. (bfgs only)

trust_radius_min.description: Minimum ionic displacement in the structural relaxation BFGS is reset when trust_radius < trust_radius_min. (bfgs only)

trust_radius_ini.description: Initial ionic displacement in the structural relaxation. (bfgs only)

w_2.description: Parameters used in line search based on the Wolfe conditions. (bfgs only)

fire_alpha_init.description: Initial value of the alpha mixing factor in the FIRE minimization scheme; recommended values are between 0.1 and 0.3

fire_falpha.description: Scaling of the alpha mixing parameter for steps with P > 0;

fire_nmin.description: Minimum number of steps with P > 0 before increase of dt

fire_dtmax.description: Determines the maximum value of dt in the FIRE minimization; dtmax = fire_dtmax*dt

oneOf.description: K_POINTS tpiba | crystal | tpiba_b | crystal_b | tpiba_c | crystal_c
K_POINTS automatic
K_POINTS gamma

nat.description: number of atoms in the unit cell (ALL atoms, except if space_group is set, in which case, INEQUIVALENT atoms)

ntyp.description: number of types of atoms in the unit cell

nbnd.description: Default: for an insulator, nbnd = number of valence bands (nbnd = # of electrons /2); for a metal, 20% more (minimum 4 more)

nbnd_cond.description: Default: nbnd_cond = nbnd - # of electrons / 2 in the collinear case; nbnd_cond = nbnd - # of electrons in the noncollinear case.

starting_charge.description: starting charge on atomic type 'i', to create starting potential with startingpot = 'atomic'.

tot_magnetization.description: Total majority spin charge - minority spin charge. Used to impose a specific total electronic magnetization. If unspecified then tot_magnetization variable is ignored and the amount of electronic magnetization is determined during the self-consistent cycle.

ecutrho.description: Kinetic energy cutoff (Ry) for charge density and potential For norm-conserving pseudopotential you should stick to the default value, you can reduce it by a little but it will introduce noise especially on forces and stress. Default: 4 * ecutwfc

ecutfock.description: Kinetic energy cutoff (Ry) for the exact exchange operator in EXX type calculations. By default this is the same as ecutrho but in some EXX calculations, a significant speed-up can be obtained by reducing ecutfock, at the expense of some loss in accuracy. Must be .gt. ecutwfc. Not implemented for stress calculation and for US-PP and PAW pseudopotentials.

nr1.description: Three-dimensional FFT mesh (hard grid) for charge density (and scf potential). If not specified the grid is calculated based on the cutoff for charge density (see also ecutrho)

nr2.description: Three-dimensional FFT mesh (hard grid) for charge density (and scf potential). If not specified the grid is calculated based on the cutoff for charge density (see also ecutrho)

nr3.description: Three-dimensional FFT mesh (hard grid) for charge density (and scf potential). If not specified the grid is calculated based on the cutoff for charge density (see also ecutrho)

nr1s.description: Three-dimensional mesh for wavefunction FFT and for the smooth part of charge density ( smooth grid ). Coincides with nr1, nr2, nr3 if ecutrho = 4 * ecutwfc ( default )

nr2s.description: Three-dimensional mesh for wavefunction FFT and for the smooth part of charge density ( smooth grid ). Coincides with nr1, nr2, nr3 if ecutrho = 4 * ecutwfc ( default )

nr3s.description: Three-dimensional mesh for wavefunction FFT and for the smooth part of charge density ( smooth grid ). Coincides with nr1, nr2, nr3 if ecutrho = 4 * ecutwfc ( default )

noinv.description: if (.TRUE.) disable the usage of k => -k symmetry (time reversal) in k-point generation

no_t_rev.description: if (.TRUE.) disable the usage of magnetic symmetry operations that consist in a rotation + time reversal.

force_symmorphic.description: if (.TRUE.) force the symmetry group to be symmorphic by disabling symmetry operations having an associated fractionary translation

degauss_cond.description: value of the gaussian spreading (Ry) for brillouin-zone integration in the conduction manifold in a two-chemical potential calculation (twochem=.true.).

nelec_cond.description: Number of electrons placed in the conduction manifold in a two-chemical potential calculation (twochem=.true.). Of the total # of electrons nelec, nelec-nelec_cond will occupy the valence manifold and nelec_cond will be constrained in the conduction manifold.

degauss.description: value of the gaussian spreading (Ry) for brillouin-zone integration in metals.

sic_energy.description: Enable the calculation of the total energy in gammaDFT. When .true., a preliminary calculation is performed to calculate the electron density in the absence of the polaron. When .false., the total energy printed in output should not be considered. For structural relaxations, it is recommended to use .false. to avoid doubling the computational cost.

sci_vb.description: Valence band shift (in eV) through self-consistent scissor operator. When performing gammaDFT calculations of polarons, the polaron level is not shifted.

sci_cb.description: Conduction band band shift (in eV) through self-consistent scissor operator. When performing gammaDFT calculations of polarons, the polaron level is not shifted.

noncolin.description: if .true. the program will perform a noncollinear calculation.

input_dft.description: Exchange-correlation functional: eg 'PBE', 'BLYP' etc See Modules/funct.f90 for allowed values. Overrides the value read from pseudopotential files. Use with care and if you know what you are doing!

ace.description: Use Adaptively Compressed Exchange operator as in Lin Lin, J. Chem. Theory Comput. 2016, 12, 2242--2249, doi:10.1021/acs.jctc.6b00092

exx_fraction.description: Fraction of EXX for hybrid functional calculations. In the case of input_dft='PBE0', the default value is 0.25, while for input_dft='B3LYP' the exx_fraction default value is 0.20.

screening_parameter.description: screening_parameter for HSE like hybrid functionals.

x_gamma_extrapolation.description: Specific for EXX. If .true., extrapolate the G=0 term of the potential

ecutvcut.description: Reciprocal space cutoff for correcting Coulomb potential divergencies at small q vectors.

nqx1.description: Three-dimensional mesh for q (k1-k2) sampling of the Fock operator (EXX). Can be smaller than the number of k-points.

nqx2.description: Three-dimensional mesh for q (k1-k2) sampling of the Fock operator (EXX). Can be smaller than the number of k-points.

nqx3.description: Three-dimensional mesh for q (k1-k2) sampling of the Fock operator (EXX). Can be smaller than the number of k-points.

localization_thr.description: Overlap threshold over which the exchange integral over a pair of localized orbitals is included in the evaluation of EXX operator. Any value greater than 0.0 triggers the SCDM localization and the evaluation on EXX using the localized orbitals. Very small value of the threshold should yield the same result as the default EXX evaluation

dmft.description: If true, nscf calculation will exit in restart mode, scf calculation will restart from there if DMFT updates are provided as hdf5 archive. Scf calculation should be used only with electron_maxstep = 1.

ensemble_energies.description: If ensemble_energies = .true., an ensemble of xc energies is calculated non-selfconsistently for perturbed exchange-enhancement factors and LDA vs. PBE correlation ratios after each converged electronic ground state calculation.

edir.description: The direction of the electric field or dipole correction is parallel to the bg(:,edir) reciprocal lattice vector, so the potential is constant in planes defined by FFT grid points; edir = 1, 2 or 3. Used only if tefield is .TRUE.

emaxpos.description: Position of the maximum of the saw-like potential along crystal axis edir, within the  unit cell (see below), 0 < emaxpos < 1 Used only if tefield is .TRUE.

eopreg.description: Zone in the unit cell where the saw-like potential decreases. ( see below, 0 < eopreg < 1 ). Used only if tefield is .TRUE.

angle1.description: The angle expressed in degrees between the initial magnetization and the z-axis. For noncollinear calculations only; index i runs over the atom types.

angle2.description: The angle expressed in degrees between the projection of the initial magnetization on x-y plane and the x-axis. For noncollinear calculations only.

lforcet.description: When starting a non collinear calculation using an existing density file from a collinear lsda calculation assumes previous density points in z direction and rotates it in the direction described by angle1 and angle2 variables for atomic type 1

constrained_magnetization.description: Used to perform constrained calculations in magnetic systems.

lambda.description: parameter used for constrained_magnetization calculations N.B.: if the scf calculation does not converge, try to reduce lambda to obtain convergence, then restart the run with a larger lambda

report.description: determines when atomic magnetic moments are printed on output

lspinorb.description: if .TRUE. the noncollinear code can use a pseudopotential with spin-orbit.

assume_isolated.description: Used to perform calculation assuming the system to be isolated (a molecule or a cluster in a 3D supercell)

esm_bc.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm', determines the boundary conditions used for either side of the slab.

esm_w.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm', determines the position offset [in a.u.] of the start of the effective screening region, measured relative to the cell edge. (ESM region begins at z = +/- [L_z/2 + esm_w] ).

esm_efield.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm' and esm_bc = 'bc2', gives the magnitude of the electric field [Ry/a.u.] to be applied between semi-infinite ESM electrodes.

esm_nfit.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm', gives the number of z-grid points for the polynomial fit along the cell edge.

lgcscf.description: If .TRUE. perform a constant bias potential (constant-mu) calculation with Grand-Canonical SCF.

gcscf_mu.description: The target Fermi energy (eV) of GC-SCF. One can start with appropriate total charge of the system by giving tot_charge

gcscf_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold of Fermi energy (eV) for GC-SCF.

gcscf_beta.description: Mixing factor for GC-SCF. Larger values are recommended, if systems with small DOS on Fermi surface as graphite.

vdw_corr.description: Type of Van der Waals correction

london_s6.description: global scaling parameter for DFT-D. Default is good for PBE.

london_c6.description: atomic C6 coefficient of each atom type

london_rvdw.description: atomic vdw radii of each atom type

dftd3_version.description: Version of Grimme implementation of Grimme-D3

dftd3_threebody.description: Turn three-body terms in Grimme-D3 on. If .false. two-body contributions only are computed, using two-body parameters of Grimme-D3. If dftd3_version=2, three-body contribution is always disabled.

ts_vdw_econv_thr.description: Optional: controls the convergence of the vdW energy (and forces). The default value is a safe choice, likely too safe, but you do not gain much in increasing it

ts_vdw_isolated.description: Optional: set it to .TRUE. when computing the Tkatchenko-Scheffler vdW energy or the Many-Body dispersion (MBD) energy for an isolated (non-periodic) system.

space_group.description: The number of the space group of the crystal, as given in the International Tables of Crystallography A (ITA)

origin_choice.description: Used only for space groups that in the ITA allow the use of two different origins

rhombohedral.description: Used only for rhombohedral space groups.

block_1.description: used only if gate = .TRUE. and block = .TRUE.

block_2.description: used only if gate = .TRUE. and block = .TRUE.

block_height.description: used only if gate = .TRUE. and block = .TRUE.

nextffield.description: Number of activated external ionic force fields.

calculation.description: A string describing the task to be performed

verbosity.description: Currently two verbosity levels are implemented: high, low. 'debug' and 'medium' have the same effect as 'high'; 'default' and 'minimal' as 'low'

nstep.description: Default: 1 if calculation == 'scf', 'nscf', 'bands'; 50 for the other cases; Number of molecular-dynamics or structural optimization steps performed in this run. If set to 0, the code performs a quick "dry run", stopping just after initialization. This is useful to check for input correctness and to have the summary printed. NOTE: in MD calculations, the code will perform "nstep" steps even if restarting from a previously interrupted calculation.

iprint.description: band energies are written every iprint iterations

tstress.description: calculate stress. It is set to .TRUE. automatically if calculation == 'vc-md' or 'vc-relax'

tprnfor.description: calculate forces. It is set to .TRUE. automatically if calculation == 'relax','md','vc-md'

dt.description: time step for molecular dynamics, in Rydberg atomic units (1 a.u.=4.8378 * 10^-17 s : beware, the CP code uses Hartree atomic units, half that much!!!)

outdir.description: input, temporary, output files are found in this directory, see also wfcdir

wfcdir.description: This directory specifies where to store files generated by each processor (*.wfc{N}, *.igk{N}, etc.). Useful for machines without a parallel file system: set wfcdir to a local file system, while outdir should be a parallel or network file system, visible to all processors. Beware: in order to restart from interrupted runs, or to perform further calculations using the produced data files, you may need to copy files to outdir. Works only for pw.x.

prefix.description: prepended to input/output filenames: prefix.wfc, prefix.rho, etc.

max_seconds.description: Jobs stops after max_seconds CPU time. Use this option in conjunction with option restart_mode if you need to split a job too long to complete into shorter jobs that fit into your batch queues.

etot_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold on total energy (a.u) for ionic minimization: the convergence criterion is satisfied when the total energy changes less than etot_conv_thr between two consecutive scf steps. Note that etot_conv_thr is extensive, like the total energy. See also forc_conv_thr - both criteria must be satisfied

forc_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold on forces (a.u) for ionic minimization: the convergence criterion is satisfied when all components of all forces are smaller than forc_conv_thr. See also etot_conv_thr - both criteria must be satisfied

disk_io.description: Specifies the amount of disk I/O activity: (only for binary files and xml data file in data directory; other files printed at each molecular dynamics / structural optimization step are not controlled by this option )

pseudo_dir.description: directory containing pseudopotential files. Default: value of the $ESPRESSO_PSEUDO environment variable if set; '$HOME/espresso/pseudo/' otherwise

tefield.description: If .TRUE. a saw-like potential simulating an electric field is added to the bare ionic potential. See variables edir, eamp, emaxpos, eopreg for the form and size of the added potential.

dipfield.description: If .TRUE. and tefield==.TRUE. a dipole correction is also added to the bare ionic potential - implements the recipe of L. Bengtsson, PRB 59, 12301 (1999). See variables edir, emaxpos, eopreg for the form of the correction. Must be used ONLY in a slab geometry, for surface calculations, with the discontinuity FALLING IN THE EMPTY SPACE.

lelfield.description: If .TRUE. a homogeneous finite electric field described through the modern theory of the polarization is applied. This is different from tefield == .true. !

nberrycyc.description: In the case of a finite electric field  ( lelfield == .TRUE. ) it defines the number of iterations for converging the wavefunctions in the electric field Hamiltonian, for each external iteration on the charge density

lberry.description: If .TRUE. perform a Berry phase calculation. See the header of PW/src/bp_c_phase.f90 for documentation

gdir.description: For Berry phase calculation: direction of the k-point strings in reciprocal space. Allowed values: 1, 2, 3 1=first, 2=second, 3=third reciprocal lattice vector For calculations with finite electric fields (lelfield==.true.) "gdir" is the direction of the field.

nppstr.description: For Berry phase calculation: number of k-points to be calculated along each symmetry-reduced string. The same for calculation with finite electric fields (lelfield==.true.).

gate.description: In the case of charged cells (tot_charge .ne. 0) setting gate = .TRUE. represents the counter charge (i.e. -tot_charge) not by a homogeneous background charge but with a charged plate, which is placed at zgate (see below). Details of the gate potential can be found in T. Brumme, M. Calandra, F. Mauri; PRB 89, 245406 (2014). Note, that in systems which are not symmetric with respect to the plate, one needs to enable the dipole correction! (dipfield=.true.). Currently, symmetry can be used with gate=.true. but carefully check that no symmetry is included which maps z to -z even if in principle one could still use them for symmetric systems (i.e. no dipole correction). For nosym=.false. verbosity is set to 'high'. Note: this option was called "monopole" in v6.0 and 6.1 of pw.x

twochem.description: IF .TRUE. , a two chemical potential calculation for the simulation of photoexcited systems is performed, constraining a fraction of the electrons in the conduction manifold.

lfcp.description: If .TRUE. perform a constant bias potential (constant-mu) calculation for a system with ESM method. See the header of PW/src/fcp_module.f90 for documentation. To perform the calculation, you must set a namelist FCP.

trism.description: If .TRUE. perform a 3D-RISM-SCF calculation [for details see H.Sato et al., JCP 112, 9463 (2000), doi:10.1063/1.481564]. The solvent's distributions are calculated by 3D-RISM, though solute is treated as SCF. The charge density and the atomic positions are optimized, simultaneously with the solvents. To perform the calculation, you must set a namelist RISM and a card SOLVENTS. If assume_isolated = 'esm' and esm_bc = 'bc1', Laue-RISM is calculated instead of 3D-RISM and coupled with ESM method (i.e. ESM-RISM). [for details see S.Nishihara and M.Otani, PRB 96, 115429 (2017)]. The default of mixing_beta is 0.2 for both 3D-RISM and Laue-RISM. For structural relaxation with BFGS, ignore_wolfe is always .TRUE. .

nat.description: number of atoms in the unit cell (ALL atoms, except if space_group is set, in which case, INEQUIVALENT atoms)

ntyp.description: number of types of atoms in the unit cell

nbnd.description: Default: for an insulator, nbnd = number of valence bands (nbnd = # of electrons /2); for a metal, 20% more (minimum 4 more)

nbnd_cond.description: Default: nbnd_cond = nbnd - # of electrons / 2 in the collinear case; nbnd_cond = nbnd - # of electrons in the noncollinear case.

starting_charge.description: starting charge on atomic type 'i', to create starting potential with startingpot = 'atomic'.

tot_magnetization.description: Total majority spin charge - minority spin charge. Used to impose a specific total electronic magnetization. If unspecified then tot_magnetization variable is ignored and the amount of electronic magnetization is determined during the self-consistent cycle.

ecutrho.description: Kinetic energy cutoff (Ry) for charge density and potential For norm-conserving pseudopotential you should stick to the default value, you can reduce it by a little but it will introduce noise especially on forces and stress. Default: 4 * ecutwfc

ecutfock.description: Kinetic energy cutoff (Ry) for the exact exchange operator in EXX type calculations. By default this is the same as ecutrho but in some EXX calculations, a significant speed-up can be obtained by reducing ecutfock, at the expense of some loss in accuracy. Must be .gt. ecutwfc. Not implemented for stress calculation and for US-PP and PAW pseudopotentials.

nr1.description: Three-dimensional FFT mesh (hard grid) for charge density (and scf potential). If not specified the grid is calculated based on the cutoff for charge density (see also ecutrho)

nr2.description: Three-dimensional FFT mesh (hard grid) for charge density (and scf potential). If not specified the grid is calculated based on the cutoff for charge density (see also ecutrho)

nr3.description: Three-dimensional FFT mesh (hard grid) for charge density (and scf potential). If not specified the grid is calculated based on the cutoff for charge density (see also ecutrho)

nr1s.description: Three-dimensional mesh for wavefunction FFT and for the smooth part of charge density ( smooth grid ). Coincides with nr1, nr2, nr3 if ecutrho = 4 * ecutwfc ( default )

nr2s.description: Three-dimensional mesh for wavefunction FFT and for the smooth part of charge density ( smooth grid ). Coincides with nr1, nr2, nr3 if ecutrho = 4 * ecutwfc ( default )

nr3s.description: Three-dimensional mesh for wavefunction FFT and for the smooth part of charge density ( smooth grid ). Coincides with nr1, nr2, nr3 if ecutrho = 4 * ecutwfc ( default )

noinv.description: if (.TRUE.) disable the usage of k => -k symmetry (time reversal) in k-point generation

no_t_rev.description: if (.TRUE.) disable the usage of magnetic symmetry operations that consist in a rotation + time reversal.

force_symmorphic.description: if (.TRUE.) force the symmetry group to be symmorphic by disabling symmetry operations having an associated fractionary translation

degauss_cond.description: value of the gaussian spreading (Ry) for brillouin-zone integration in the conduction manifold in a two-chemical potential calculation (twochem=.true.).

nelec_cond.description: Number of electrons placed in the conduction manifold in a two-chemical potential calculation (twochem=.true.). Of the total # of electrons nelec, nelec-nelec_cond will occupy the valence manifold and nelec_cond will be constrained in the conduction manifold.

degauss.description: value of the gaussian spreading (Ry) for brillouin-zone integration in metals.

sic_energy.description: Enable the calculation of the total energy in gammaDFT. When .true., a preliminary calculation is performed to calculate the electron density in the absence of the polaron. When .false., the total energy printed in output should not be considered. For structural relaxations, it is recommended to use .false. to avoid doubling the computational cost.

sci_vb.description: Valence band shift (in eV) through self-consistent scissor operator. When performing gammaDFT calculations of polarons, the polaron level is not shifted.

sci_cb.description: Conduction band band shift (in eV) through self-consistent scissor operator. When performing gammaDFT calculations of polarons, the polaron level is not shifted.

noncolin.description: if .true. the program will perform a noncollinear calculation.

input_dft.description: Exchange-correlation functional: eg 'PBE', 'BLYP' etc See Modules/funct.f90 for allowed values. Overrides the value read from pseudopotential files. Use with care and if you know what you are doing!

ace.description: Use Adaptively Compressed Exchange operator as in Lin Lin, J. Chem. Theory Comput. 2016, 12, 2242--2249, doi:10.1021/acs.jctc.6b00092

exx_fraction.description: Fraction of EXX for hybrid functional calculations. In the case of input_dft='PBE0', the default value is 0.25, while for input_dft='B3LYP' the exx_fraction default value is 0.20.

screening_parameter.description: screening_parameter for HSE like hybrid functionals.

x_gamma_extrapolation.description: Specific for EXX. If .true., extrapolate the G=0 term of the potential

ecutvcut.description: Reciprocal space cutoff for correcting Coulomb potential divergencies at small q vectors.

nqx1.description: Three-dimensional mesh for q (k1-k2) sampling of the Fock operator (EXX). Can be smaller than the number of k-points.

nqx2.description: Three-dimensional mesh for q (k1-k2) sampling of the Fock operator (EXX). Can be smaller than the number of k-points.

nqx3.description: Three-dimensional mesh for q (k1-k2) sampling of the Fock operator (EXX). Can be smaller than the number of k-points.

localization_thr.description: Overlap threshold over which the exchange integral over a pair of localized orbitals is included in the evaluation of EXX operator. Any value greater than 0.0 triggers the SCDM localization and the evaluation on EXX using the localized orbitals. Very small value of the threshold should yield the same result as the default EXX evaluation

dmft.description: If true, nscf calculation will exit in restart mode, scf calculation will restart from there if DMFT updates are provided as hdf5 archive. Scf calculation should be used only with electron_maxstep = 1.

ensemble_energies.description: If ensemble_energies = .true., an ensemble of xc energies is calculated non-selfconsistently for perturbed exchange-enhancement factors and LDA vs. PBE correlation ratios after each converged electronic ground state calculation.

edir.description: The direction of the electric field or dipole correction is parallel to the bg(:,edir) reciprocal lattice vector, so the potential is constant in planes defined by FFT grid points; edir = 1, 2 or 3. Used only if tefield is .TRUE.

emaxpos.description: Position of the maximum of the saw-like potential along crystal axis edir, within the  unit cell (see below), 0 < emaxpos < 1 Used only if tefield is .TRUE.

eopreg.description: Zone in the unit cell where the saw-like potential decreases. ( see below, 0 < eopreg < 1 ). Used only if tefield is .TRUE.

angle1.description: The angle expressed in degrees between the initial magnetization and the z-axis. For noncollinear calculations only; index i runs over the atom types.

angle2.description: The angle expressed in degrees between the projection of the initial magnetization on x-y plane and the x-axis. For noncollinear calculations only.

lforcet.description: When starting a non collinear calculation using an existing density file from a collinear lsda calculation assumes previous density points in z direction and rotates it in the direction described by angle1 and angle2 variables for atomic type 1

constrained_magnetization.description: Used to perform constrained calculations in magnetic systems.

lambda.description: parameter used for constrained_magnetization calculations N.B.: if the scf calculation does not converge, try to reduce lambda to obtain convergence, then restart the run with a larger lambda

report.description: determines when atomic magnetic moments are printed on output

lspinorb.description: if .TRUE. the noncollinear code can use a pseudopotential with spin-orbit.

assume_isolated.description: Used to perform calculation assuming the system to be isolated (a molecule or a cluster in a 3D supercell)

esm_bc.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm', determines the boundary conditions used for either side of the slab.

esm_w.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm', determines the position offset [in a.u.] of the start of the effective screening region, measured relative to the cell edge. (ESM region begins at z = +/- [L_z/2 + esm_w] ).

esm_efield.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm' and esm_bc = 'bc2', gives the magnitude of the electric field [Ry/a.u.] to be applied between semi-infinite ESM electrodes.

esm_nfit.description: If assume_isolated = 'esm', gives the number of z-grid points for the polynomial fit along the cell edge.

lgcscf.description: If .TRUE. perform a constant bias potential (constant-mu) calculation with Grand-Canonical SCF.

gcscf_mu.description: The target Fermi energy (eV) of GC-SCF. One can start with appropriate total charge of the system by giving tot_charge

gcscf_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold of Fermi energy (eV) for GC-SCF.

gcscf_beta.description: Mixing factor for GC-SCF. Larger values are recommended, if systems with small DOS on Fermi surface as graphite.

vdw_corr.description: Type of Van der Waals correction

london_s6.description: global scaling parameter for DFT-D. Default is good for PBE.

london_c6.description: atomic C6 coefficient of each atom type

london_rvdw.description: atomic vdw radii of each atom type

dftd3_version.description: Version of Grimme implementation of Grimme-D3

dftd3_threebody.description: Turn three-body terms in Grimme-D3 on. If .false. two-body contributions only are computed, using two-body parameters of Grimme-D3. If dftd3_version=2, three-body contribution is always disabled.

ts_vdw_econv_thr.description: Optional: controls the convergence of the vdW energy (and forces). The default value is a safe choice, likely too safe, but you do not gain much in increasing it

ts_vdw_isolated.description: Optional: set it to .TRUE. when computing the Tkatchenko-Scheffler vdW energy or the Many-Body dispersion (MBD) energy for an isolated (non-periodic) system.

space_group.description: The number of the space group of the crystal, as given in the International Tables of Crystallography A (ITA)

origin_choice.description: Used only for space groups that in the ITA allow the use of two different origins

rhombohedral.description: Used only for rhombohedral space groups.

block_1.description: used only if gate = .TRUE. and block = .TRUE.

block_2.description: used only if gate = .TRUE. and block = .TRUE.

block_height.description: used only if gate = .TRUE. and block = .TRUE.

nextffield.description: Number of activated external ionic force fields.

electron_maxstep.description: maximum number of iterations in a scf step. If exact exchange is active, this will affect the inner loops.

exx_maxstep.description: maximum number of outer iterations in a scf calculation with exact exchange.

scf_must_converge.description: If .false. do not stop molecular dynamics or ionic relaxation when electron_maxstep is reached. Use with care.

adaptive_thr.description: If .TRUE. this turns on the use of an adaptive conv_thr for the inner scf loops when using EXX.

conv_thr_init.description: When adaptive_thr = .TRUE. this is the convergence threshold used for the first scf cycle.

conv_thr_multi.description: When adaptive_thr = .TRUE. the convergence threshold for each scf cycle is given by: max( conv_thr, conv_thr_multi * dexx )

mixing_ndim.description: number of iterations used in mixing scheme

mixing_fixed_ns.description: For DFT+U : number of iterations with fixed ns ( ns is the atomic density appearing in the Hubbard term ).

diago_thr_init.description: Convergence threshold (ethr) for iterative diagonalization (the check is on eigenvalue convergence).

diago_cg_maxiter.description: For conjugate gradient diagonalization:  max number of iterations

diago_ppcg_maxiter.description: For ppcg diagonalization:  max number of iterations

diago_david_ndim.description: For Davidson diagonalization: dimension of workspace (number of wavefunction packets, at least 2 needed).

diago_rmm_ndim.description: For RMM-DIIS diagonalization: dimension of workspace (number of wavefunction packets, at least 2 needed).

diago_rmm_conv.description: If .TRUE., RMM-DIIS is performed up to converge. If .FALSE., RMM-DIIS is performed only once.

diago_gs_nblock.description: For RMM-DIIS diagonalization: blocking size of Gram-Schmidt orthogonalization

diago_full_acc.description: If .TRUE. all the empty states are diagonalized at the same level of accuracy of the occupied ones. Otherwise the empty states are diagonalized using a larger threshold (this should not affect total energy, forces, and other ground-state properties).

efield.description: Amplitude of the finite electric field (in Ry a.u.; 1 a.u. = 36.3609*10^10 V/m). Used only if lelfield==.TRUE. and if k-points (K_POINTS card) are not automatic.

tqr.description: If .true., use a real-space algorithm for augmentation charges of ultrasoft pseudopotentials and PAWsets. Faster but numerically less accurate than the default G-space algorithm. Use with care and after testing!

real_space.description: If .true., exploit real-space localization to compute matrix elements for nonlocal projectors. Faster and in principle better scaling than the default G-space algorithm, but numerically less accurate, may lead to some loss of translational invariance. Use with care and after testing!

pot_extrapolation.description: Used to extrapolate the potential from preceding ionic steps.

wfc_extrapolation.description: Used to extrapolate the wavefunctions from preceding ionic steps.

remove_rigid_rot.description: This keyword is useful when simulating the dynamics and/or the thermodynamics of an isolated system. If set to true the total torque of the internal forces is set to zero by adding new forces that compensate the spurious interaction with the periodic images. This allows for the use of smaller supercells.

tempw.description: Starting temperature (Kelvin) in MD runs target temperature for most thermostats.

tolp.description: Tolerance for velocity rescaling. Velocities are rescaled if the run-averaged and target temperature differ more than tolp.

refold_pos.description: This keyword applies only in the case of molecular dynamics or damped dynamics. If true the ions are refolded at each step into the supercell.

upscale.description: Max reduction factor for conv_thr during structural optimization conv_thr is automatically reduced when the relaxation approaches convergence so that forces are still accurate, but conv_thr will not be reduced to less that conv_thr / upscale.

bfgs_ndim.description: Number of old forces and displacements vectors used in the PULAY mixing of the residual vectors obtained on the basis of the inverse hessian matrix given by the BFGS algorithm.

trust_radius_max.description: Maximum ionic displacement in the structural relaxation. (bfgs only)

trust_radius_min.description: Minimum ionic displacement in the structural relaxation BFGS is reset when trust_radius < trust_radius_min. (bfgs only)

trust_radius_ini.description: Initial ionic displacement in the structural relaxation. (bfgs only)

w_2.description: Parameters used in line search based on the Wolfe conditions. (bfgs only)

fire_alpha_init.description: Initial value of the alpha mixing factor in the FIRE minimization scheme; recommended values are between 0.1 and 0.3

fire_falpha.description: Scaling of the alpha mixing parameter for steps with P > 0;

fire_nmin.description: Minimum number of steps with P > 0 before increase of dt

fire_dtmax.description: Determines the maximum value of dt in the FIRE minimization; dtmax = fire_dtmax*dt

press.description: Target pressure [KBar] in a variable-cell md or relaxation run.

wmass.description: Fictitious cell mass [amu] for variable-cell simulations (both 'vc-md' and 'vc-relax'). Default: 0.75*Tot_Mass/pi**2 for Parrinello-Rahman MD; 0.75*Tot_Mass/pi**2/Omega**(2/3) for Wentzcovitch MD

cell_factor.description: Used in the construction of the pseudopotential tables. It should exceed the maximum linear contraction of the cell during a simulation. Default: 2.0 for variable-cell calculations, 1.0 otherwise

press_conv_thr.description: Convergence threshold on the pressure for variable cell relaxation ('vc-relax' : note that the other convergence thresholds for ionic relaxation apply as well).

cell_dofree.description: Select which of the cell parameters should be moved

X.description: label of the atom. Acceptable syntax: chemical symbol X (1 or 2 characters, case-insensitive) or chemical symbol plus a number or a letter, as in "Xn" (e.g. Fe1) or "X_*" or "X-*" (e.g. C1, C_h; max total length cannot exceed 3 characters)

Mass_X.description: mass of the atomic species [amu: mass of C = 12]. Used only when performing Molecular Dynamics run or structural optimization runs using Damped MD. Not actually used in all other cases (but stored in data files, so phonon calculations will use these values unless other values are provided)

X.description: label of the atom as specified in ATOMIC_SPECIES

oneOf.description: K_POINTS tpiba | crystal | tpiba_b | crystal_b | tpiba_c | crystal_c
K_POINTS automatic
K_POINTS gamma

card_option.description: label of the atom. Acceptable syntax: chemical symbol X (1 or 2 characters, case-insensitive) or chemical symbol plus a number or a letter, as in "Xn" (e.g. Fe1) or "X_*" or "X-*" (e.g. C1, C_h; max total length cannot exceed 3 characters)

oneOf.description: IF DFT+U
https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1764

U.description: string constant "U"; indicates the specs for the U parameter will be given

label.description: label of the atom (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

u_val.description: value of the U parameter (in eV)

J0.description: string constant "J0"; indicates the specs for the J0 parameter will be given

j0_val.description: value of the J0 parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: IF DFT+U+J

items.description: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1817

paramType.description: character describing the type of Hubbard parameter allowed values: U, J and either B (for d-orbitals) or E2 and E3 (for f-orbitals)

label.description: label of the atom (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

paramValue.description: value of the J0 parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: IF DFT+U+V
https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1847

U.description: string constant "U"; indicates the specs for the U parameter will be given

u_val.description: value of the U parameter (in eV)

j0_val.description: value of the J0 parameter (in eV)

oneOf.description: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/Doc/INPUT_PW.html#idm1884

V.description: string constant "V"; indicates the specs for the V parameter will be given

label(I).description: label of the atom I (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

manifold(I).description: specs of the manifold for atom I (e.g., 3d, 2p...)

label(J).description: label of the atom J (as defined in ATOMIC_SPECIES)

manifold(J).description: specs of the manifold for atom J (e.g., 3d, 2p...)

v_val(I,J).description: value of the V parameter for the atom pair I,J (in eV)

xDataArray.description: array containing values of x Axis

legend.description: Legend of y Axis data series

xDataArray.description: array containing values of x Axis

a.description: length of the first lattice vector

b.description: length of the second lattice vector

c.description: length of the third lattice vector

alpha.description: angle between first and second lattice vector

beta.description: angle between second and third lattice vector

gamma.description: angle between first and third lattice vector

This is useful, for example, when tracking the history of a value referenced in a scholarly article; the top level reference would contain information about where the data was accessed while the nested reference would contain information about where it was originally published.

rmsId.description: Identity used to track jobs originated from command-line

startTime.description: Approximate start time of the job. e.g. within 10 min

workDir.description: The path to the working directory of this job, when the job originates from command-line

compute.title: compute arguments schema
compute.description: Custom keywords prefixed with validate correspond to custom validation methods implemented downstream

queue.description: Name of the submission queues: https://docs.mat3ra.com/infrastructure/resource/queues/. Below enums are for Azure, then AWS circa 2022-08, hence the duplication.

nodes.description: number of nodes used for the job inside the RMS.

ppn.description: number of CPUs used for the job inside the RMS.

timeLimit.description: Wallclock time limit for computing a job. Clock format: 'hh:mm:ss'

timeLimitType.description: Convention to use when reasoning about time limits

isRestartable.description: Job is allowed to restart on termination.

notify.description: Email notification for the job: n - never, a - job aborted, b - job begins, e - job ends. Last three could be combined.

email.description: Email address to notify about job execution.

maxCPU.description: Maximum CPU count per node. This parameter is used to let backend job submission infrastructure know that this job is to be charged for the maximum CPU per node instead of the actual ppn. For premium/fast queues where resources are provisioned on-demand and exclusively per user.

arguments.description: Optional arguments specific to using application - VASP, Quantum Espresso, etc. Specified elsewhere
arguments.title: quantum espresso arguments schema

nimage.description: Processors can be divided into different `images`, each corresponding to a different self-consistent or linear-response calculation, loosely coupled to others.

npools.description: Each image can be subpartitioned into `pools`, each taking care of a group of k-points.

nband.description: Each pool is subpartitioned into `band groups`, each taking care of a group of Kohn-Sham orbitals (also called bands, or wavefunctions).

ntg.description: In order to allow good parallelization of the 3D FFT when the number of processors exceeds the number of FFT planes, FFTs on Kohn-Sham states are redistributed to `task` groups so that each group can process several wavefunctions at the same time.

ndiag.description: A further level of parallelization, independent on PW or k-point parallelization, is the parallelization of subspace diagonalization / iterative orthonormalization. Both operations required the diagonalization of arrays whose dimension is the number of Kohn-Sham states (or a small multiple of it). All such arrays are distributed block-like across the `linear-algebra group`, a subgroup of the pool of processors, organized in a square 2D grid. As a consequence the number of processors in the linear-algebra group is given by n2, where n is an integer; n2 must be smaller than the number of processors in the PW group. The diagonalization is then performed in parallel using standard linear algebra operations.

cluster.description: Cluster where the job is executed. Optional on create. Required on job submission.

fqdn.description: FQDN of the cluster. e.g. master-1-staging.exabyte.io

errors.description: Computation error. Optional. Appears only if something happens on jobs execution.

reason.description: Should be a short, unique, machine-readable error code string. e.g. FileNotFound

message.description: Human-readable error message. e.g. 'File Not Found: /home/demo/data/project1/job-123/job-config.json'

traceback.description: Full machine-readable error traceback. e.g. FileNotFound

excludeFilesPattern.description: A Python compatible regex to exclude files from upload. e.g. ^.*.txt& excludes all files with .txt suffix

runtimeContext.description: Context variables that the job will have access to at runtime

scopeTrack.description: history of the workflow scope on each update

name.description: entity name

isDraft.description: Defines whether to store the results/properties extracted in this unit to properties collection

name.description: Human-readable name of the subworkflow. e.g. Total-energy

properties.description: Array of characteristic properties calculated by this subworkflow

items.description: property names, eg. `band_gaps`, `band_structure`

oneOf.title: compute arguments schema
oneOf.description: Custom keywords prefixed with validate correspond to custom validation methods implemented downstream

queue.description: Name of the submission queues: https://docs.mat3ra.com/infrastructure/resource/queues/. Below enums are for Azure, then AWS circa 2022-08, hence the duplication.

nodes.description: number of nodes used for the job inside the RMS.

ppn.description: number of CPUs used for the job inside the RMS.

timeLimit.description: Wallclock time limit for computing a job. Clock format: 'hh:mm:ss'

timeLimitType.description: Convention to use when reasoning about time limits

isRestartable.description: Job is allowed to restart on termination.

notify.description: Email notification for the job: n - never, a - job aborted, b - job begins, e - job ends. Last three could be combined.

email.description: Email address to notify about job execution.

maxCPU.description: Maximum CPU count per node. This parameter is used to let backend job submission infrastructure know that this job is to be charged for the maximum CPU per node instead of the actual ppn. For premium/fast queues where resources are provisioned on-demand and exclusively per user.

arguments.description: Optional arguments specific to using application - VASP, Quantum Espresso, etc. Specified elsewhere
arguments.title: quantum espresso arguments schema

nimage.description: Processors can be divided into different `images`, each corresponding to a different self-consistent or linear-response calculation, loosely coupled to others.

npools.description: Each image can be subpartitioned into `pools`, each taking care of a group of k-points.

nband.description: Each pool is subpartitioned into `band groups`, each taking care of a group of Kohn-Sham orbitals (also called bands, or wavefunctions).

ntg.description: In order to allow good parallelization of the 3D FFT when the number of processors exceeds the number of FFT planes, FFTs on Kohn-Sham states are redistributed to `task` groups so that each group can process several wavefunctions at the same time.

ndiag.description: A further level of parallelization, independent on PW or k-point parallelization, is the parallelization of subspace diagonalization / iterative orthonormalization. Both operations required the diagonalization of arrays whose dimension is the number of Kohn-Sham states (or a small multiple of it). All such arrays are distributed block-like across the `linear-algebra group`, a subgroup of the pool of processors, organized in a square 2D grid. As a consequence the number of processors in the linear-algebra group is given by n2, where n is an integer; n2 must be smaller than the number of processors in the PW group. The diagonalization is then performed in parallel using standard linear algebra operations.

cluster.description: Cluster where the job is executed. Optional on create. Required on job submission.

fqdn.description: FQDN of the cluster. e.g. master-1-staging.exabyte.io

errors.description: Computation error. Optional. Appears only if something happens on jobs execution.

reason.description: Should be a short, unique, machine-readable error code string. e.g. FileNotFound

message.description: Human-readable error message. e.g. 'File Not Found: /home/demo/data/project1/job-123/job-config.json'

traceback.description: Full machine-readable error traceback. e.g. FileNotFound

excludeFilesPattern.description: A Python compatible regex to exclude files from upload. e.g. ^.*.txt& excludes all files with .txt suffix

units.description: Contains the Units of the Workflow

type.description: type of the unit

ids.description: IDs of item to retrieve from db

draft.description: whether the result should be saved as draft

NAME.description: Name of the file inside the object storage bucket

REGION.description: Region for the object container specified in Container

SIZE.description: Size of the file in bytes

TIMESTAMP.description: Unix timestamp showing when the file was last modified

overwrite.description: if a file with the same filename already exists, whether to overwrite the old file

pathname.description: Relative path to the directory that contains the file.

filetype.description: What kind of file this is, e.g. image / text

key.description: Key of the property of the entity on which the consistency check is performed in Mongo dot notation, e.g. 'basis.coordinates.1'

name.description: Name of the consistency check that is performed, which is listed in an enum.

severity.description: Severity level of the problem, which is used in UI to differentiate.

message.description: Message generated by the consistency check describing the problem.

schemaVersion.description: entity's schema version. Used to distinct between different schemas.

preProcessors.description: names of the pre-processors for this calculation

name.description: The name of this item. e.g. scf_accuracy

oneOf.title: RuntimeItemString
oneOf.description: name of runtime item in shortened notation

postProcessors.description: names of the post-processors for this calculation

name.description: The name of this item. e.g. scf_accuracy

oneOf.title: RuntimeItemString
oneOf.description: name of runtime item in shortened notation

monitors.description: names of the monitors for this calculation

name.description: The name of this item. e.g. scf_accuracy

oneOf.title: RuntimeItemString
oneOf.description: name of runtime item in shortened notation

results.description: names of the results for this calculation

name.description: The name of this item. e.g. scf_accuracy

oneOf.title: RuntimeItemString
oneOf.description: name of runtime item in shortened notation

type.description: type of the unit

workflowId.description: Id of workflow to run inside map

input.description: Input information for map.

target.description: Name of the target variable to substitute using the values below. e.g. K_POINTS

scope.description: Scope to retrieve `values` from, global or flowchartId. Optional if `values` is given.

name.description: Name of the variable inside the scope to retrieve `values` from. Optional if `values` is given.

values.description: Sequence of values for the target Jinja variable. Optional if `scope` and `name` are given. This can be used for map-reduce type parallel execution

name.description: name of the unit. e.g. pw_scf

head.description: Whether this unit is the first one to be executed.

flowchartId.description: Identity of the unit in the workflow. Used to trace the execution flow of the workflow.

next.description: Next unit's flowchartId. If empty, the current unit is the last.

enableRender.description: Whether Rupy should attempt to use Jinja templating to add context variables into the unit

properties.description: Array of characteristic properties calculated by this workflow (TODO: add enums)

items.description: property names, eg. `band_gaps`, `band_structure`

workflows.description: Array of workflows with the same schema as the current one.

items.title: consistency check
items.description: The output of consistency checks performed on data adhering to JSON schema, but inconsistent with scientific or logical rules, to show problems in UI.

key.description: Key of the property of the entity on which the consistency check is performed in Mongo dot notation, e.g. 'basis.coordinates.1'

name.description: Name of the consistency check that is performed, which is listed in an enum.

severity.description: Severity level of the problem, which is used in UI to differentiate.

message.description: Message generated by the consistency check describing the problem.

schemaVersion.description: entity's schema version. Used to distinct between different schemas.

name.description: entity name

rmsId.description: Identity used to track jobs originated from command-line

startTime.description: Approximate start time of the job. e.g. within 10 min

workDir.description: The path to the working directory of this job, when the job originates from command-line

compute.title: compute arguments schema
compute.description: Custom keywords prefixed with validate correspond to custom validation methods implemented downstream

queue.description: Name of the submission queues: https://docs.mat3ra.com/infrastructure/resource/queues/. Below enums are for Azure, then AWS circa 2022-08, hence the duplication.

nodes.description: number of nodes used for the job inside the RMS.

ppn.description: number of CPUs used for the job inside the RMS.

timeLimit.description: Wallclock time limit for computing a job. Clock format: 'hh:mm:ss'

timeLimitType.description: Convention to use when reasoning about time limits

isRestartable.description: Job is allowed to restart on termination.

notify.description: Email notification for the job: n - never, a - job aborted, b - job begins, e - job ends. Last three could be combined.

email.description: Email address to notify about job execution.

maxCPU.description: Maximum CPU count per node. This parameter is used to let backend job submission infrastructure know that this job is to be charged for the maximum CPU per node instead of the actual ppn. For premium/fast queues where resources are provisioned on-demand and exclusively per user.

arguments.description: Optional arguments specific to using application - VASP, Quantum Espresso, etc. Specified elsewhere
arguments.title: quantum espresso arguments schema

nimage.description: Processors can be divided into different `images`, each corresponding to a different self-consistent or linear-response calculation, loosely coupled to others.

npools.description: Each image can be subpartitioned into `pools`, each taking care of a group of k-points.

nband.description: Each pool is subpartitioned into `band groups`, each taking care of a group of Kohn-Sham orbitals (also called bands, or wavefunctions).

ntg.description: In order to allow good parallelization of the 3D FFT when the number of processors exceeds the number of FFT planes, FFTs on Kohn-Sham states are redistributed to `task` groups so that each group can process several wavefunctions at the same time.

ndiag.description: A further level of parallelization, independent on PW or k-point parallelization, is the parallelization of subspace diagonalization / iterative orthonormalization. Both operations required the diagonalization of arrays whose dimension is the number of Kohn-Sham states (or a small multiple of it). All such arrays are distributed block-like across the `linear-algebra group`, a subgroup of the pool of processors, organized in a square 2D grid. As a consequence the number of processors in the linear-algebra group is given by n2, where n is an integer; n2 must be smaller than the number of processors in the PW group. The diagonalization is then performed in parallel using standard linear algebra operations.

cluster.description: Cluster where the job is executed. Optional on create. Required on job submission.

fqdn.description: FQDN of the cluster. e.g. master-1-staging.exabyte.io

errors.description: Computation error. Optional. Appears only if something happens on jobs execution.

reason.description: Should be a short, unique, machine-readable error code string. e.g. FileNotFound

message.description: Human-readable error message. e.g. 'File Not Found: /home/demo/data/project1/job-123/job-config.json'

traceback.description: Full machine-readable error traceback. e.g. FileNotFound

excludeFilesPattern.description: A Python compatible regex to exclude files from upload. e.g. ^.*.txt& excludes all files with .txt suffix

runtimeContext.description: Context variables that the job will have access to at runtime

scopeTrack.description: history of the workflow scope on each update

items.description: The output of consistency checks performed on data adhering to JSON schema, but inconsistent with scientific or logical rules, to show problems in UI.

key.description: Key of the property of the entity on which the consistency check is performed in Mongo dot notation, e.g. 'basis.coordinates.1'

name.description: Name of the consistency check that is performed, which is listed in an enum.

severity.description: Severity level of the problem, which is used in UI to differentiate.

message.description: Message generated by the consistency check describing the problem.

schemaVersion.description: entity's schema version. Used to distinct between different schemas.

name.description: entity name

unitCellFormula.description: chemical formula based on the number of atoms of each element in the supercell

items.title: atomic elements
items.description: elements of atoms by ids, string, unitless

labels.description: Optional numeric label (e.g., 1, 2, as in Fe1, Fe2) to distinguish same atomic species to attach different spin magnetic moment.

items.title: atomic coordinate
items.description: coordinates of atoms by ids, vector, unitless

atomPair.description: indices of the two connected atoms
atomPair.title: atomic ids

a.description: length of the first lattice vector

b.description: length of the second lattice vector

c.description: length of the third lattice vector

alpha.description: angle between first and second lattice vector

beta.description: angle between second and third lattice vector

gamma.description: angle between first and third lattice vector

pointGroupSymbol.description: point group symbol in Schoenflies notation

spaceGroupSymbol.description: space group symbol in HermannMauguin notation

oneOf.title: elemental-ratio
oneOf.description: ration of this element in the compound

element.description: the element this ratio is for

oneOf.title: p_norm
oneOf.description: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norm_(mathematics)#p-norm

degree.description: degree of the dimensionality of the norm

id.description: ID string for the materials uploaded from a third party source inside the third party source. For materialsproject.org an example ID is mp-32

source.description: Third party source name, e.g. materials project, 2dmatpedia, ICSD, etc.

origin.description: Deprecated. To be removed. A flag that is true when material is initially imported from a third party * (as opposed to being independently designed from scratch).

url.description: The URL of the original record, e.g. https://next-gen.materialsproject.org/materials/mp-48; ToDo: update to use URI type per https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string#resource-identifiers

src.title: file source schema
src.description: file source with the information inside

hash.description: MD5 hash based on file content

scaledHash.description: Hash string for a scaled structure with lattice vector a set to 1 (eg. for materials under pressure).

icsdId.description: Corresponding ICSD id of the material

isNonPeriodic.description: Whether to work in the finite molecular picture (usually with atomic orbital basis)

message.description: Message generated by the consistency check describing the problem.

schemaVersion.description: entity's schema version. Used to distinct between different schemas.

data.description: container of the information, specific to each property

source.title: The source of a property. This could be an article, a simulation on Exabyte, an external simulation, etc.

type.description: Type of the material property's source.

unitId.description: Id of the unit that extracted the result

oneOf.title: info for characteristic obtained by experiment

authors.description: experiment authors

name.description: human-readable name of the condition

doi.description: Digital Object Identifier of the reference.

isbn.description: International Standard Book Number of the reference.

issn.description: International Standard Serial Number of the reference.

journal.description: Journal in which the work appeared.

volume.description: Volume of the series in which the work appeared.

year.description: Year in which the reference was published.

issue.description: Issue of the collection in which the work appeared.

pages.description: Start and end pages of the work.
pages.title: pages schema

authors.description: List of authors of the work.

editors.description: List of editors of the work.

reference.description: References cited by the work. Reference objects can nest as deeply as needed. This is useful, for example, when tracking the history of a value referenced in a scholarly article; the top level reference would contain information about where the data was accessed while the nested reference would contain information about where it was originally published.

exabyteId.description: Id of the corresponding item in the entity bank that this property is obtained for

count.description: total number of properties among which this property is the best.

systemTags.description: property system tags, marks property system characteristics, values refined or best (could be both)

items.title: consistency check
items.description: The output of consistency checks performed on data adhering to JSON schema, but inconsistent with scientific or logical rules, to show problems in UI.

key.description: Key of the property of the entity on which the consistency check is performed in Mongo dot notation, e.g. 'basis.coordinates.1'

name.description: Name of the consistency check that is performed, which is listed in an enum.

schemaVersion.description: entity's schema version. Used to distinct between different schemas.

nimage.description: Processors can be divided into different `images`, each corresponding to a different self-consistent or linear-response calculation, loosely coupled to others.

npools.description: Each image can be subpartitioned into `pools`, each taking care of a group of k-points.

nband.description: Each pool is subpartitioned into `band groups`, each taking care of a group of Kohn-Sham orbitals (also called bands, or wavefunctions).

ntg.description: In order to allow good parallelization of the 3D FFT when the number of processors exceeds the number of FFT planes, FFTs on Kohn-Sham states are redistributed to `task` groups so that each group can process several wavefunctions at the same time.

ndiag.description: A further level of parallelization, independent on PW or k-point parallelization, is the parallelization of subspace diagonalization / iterative orthonormalization. Both operations required the diagonalization of arrays whose dimension is the number of Kohn-Sham states (or a small multiple of it). All such arrays are distributed block-like across the `linear-algebra group`, a subgroup of the pool of processors, organized in a square 2D grid. As a consequence the number of processors in the linear-algebra group is given by n2, where n is an integer; n2 must be smaller than the number of processors in the PW group. The diagonalization is then performed in parallel using standard linear algebra operations.
